newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end at higher level.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end at higher level.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates fluctuated on Tuesday before ending higher amid a shortage of funds, dealers said.

Borrowers tried to bring the rates down in early trading, placing bids at 18.50 percent, but lenders remained adamant and most of the early trades were seen in the band of 19 and 19.75 percent, a dealer at KASB & Co said.
The closing hour saw the rates settling down at 19 percent, but majority of the day's trades were dealt between 19.50 and 20 percent, the dealer said.
